units.title: Construction of barcoded CHOOSE lentiviral vector
units.text: The CHOOSE lentiviral vector was constructed based on a previously published lentiviral vector that carries a CAG driving ERT2-Cre-ERT2-P2A-EGFP-P2A-puro cassette12. A multicloning site including NheI and SgsI recognition sequences was introduced to the 3′ LTR of the lentivirus backbone according to the CROP-seq vector design17. Then, the original U6 sgRNA expression cassette was removed; instead, the dual sgRNA (U6-sgRNA1-H1-sgRNA2) cassette was introduced to the 3′ LTR cloning site. To generate a barcoded library, the following primers were used to individually amplify (8–10 cycles, monitored using a quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) machine, stopped when reaching logarithmic phase) each dual sgRNA cassette from the lentiviral construct used in the reporter assay while introducing a 15 base pair barcode.
units.rationale: Describes the stepwise creation of the lentiviral vector and barcode incorporation.

units.title: Cerebral organoid generation (dorsal protocol)
units.text: Cerebral organoids were generated using a previously published protocol with modifications23. In brief, cells were cultured to 70–80% confluent, and 16,000 live cells in 150 μl Essential8 medium supplemented with Revitacell (ThermoFisher, catalogue no. A2644501) were added to each well of a U-bottom ultralow attachment 96-well plate (Corning, catalogue no. CLS3473) to form embryoid bodies. For eCas9 induction, 4-hydroxytamoxifen (Sigma-Aldrich, catalogue no. H7904) was added on day 5 at a concentration of 0.3 μg ml−1. Neural induction was started on day 6. Embryoid bodies were embedded in Matrigel (Corning, catalogue no. 3524234) at day 11 or 12 based on morphology check. CHIR99021 (Merck, catalogue no. 361571) at 3 μM was added from day 13 to day 16, and medium was switched to improved differentiation medium supplemented with B27 minus vitamin A (IDM-A) at day 14. On day 25, medium was switched to improved differentiation medium supplemented with B27 plus vitamin A (IDM+A); 1% Matrigel was added to the medium from day 40 to day 90. From day 60 to day 70, medium was gradually switched to Brainphys medium (Stemcell Technologies, catalogue no. 05790) and supplemented with brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) (20 ng ml−1; Stemcell Technologies, catalogue no. 78005.3), glial cell line-derived neurotrophic factor (GDNF) (20 mg ml−1; Stemcell Technologies, catalogue no. 78005.3) and bucladesine sodium (1 mM; MedChemExpress, catalogue no. EL0011) and cleaned up by phenol-chloroform extraction.
units.rationale: Provides a complete stepwise protocol for generating dorsal cerebral organoids.

units.title: Ventralized organoid generation
units.text: For ventralized organoids, we followed a previously published protocol47. Embryoid bodies were not embedded, and patterning factors, including 100 nM SAG (Merck-Millipore, catalogue no. US1566660) and 2.5 μM IWP2 (Sigma-Aldrich, catalogue no. IO536), were added from day 5 to day 11. medium was switched to improved differentiation medium supplemented with B27 minus vitamin A (IDM-A) at day 14. On day 25, medium was switched to improved differentiation medium supplemented with B27 plus vitamin A (IDM+A); 1% Matrigel was added to the medium from day 40 to day 90. From day 60 to day 70, medium was gradually switched to Brainphys medium (Stemcell Technologies, catalogue no. 05790) and supplemented with BDNF, GDNF and bucladesine sodium as described above.
units.rationale: Outlines the specific modifications for generating ventral telencephalic organoids.

units.title: sgRNA selection and cloning
units.text: sgRNA selection and cloning. The top four sgRNAs were first selected on the basis of predictions using multilayered Vienna Bioactivity CRISPR (VBC) score54 and then subjected to the reporter assay (below) to test editing efficiency. sgRNAs were cloned into the gRNA reporter lentivirus construct (containing the dual sgRNA cassette: U6-sgRNA1-H1-sgRNA2) using the GeCKO cloning protocol55.
units.rationale: Specifies how guide RNAs were chosen and inserted into the lentiviral backbone.

units.title: Lentivirus production and hES cell infection
units.text: Lentiviruses were packaged using HEK293T cells, and infection of hES cells was performed as before12. Infection rate was controlled to be lower than 5% to prevent multiple infections18; 6.6 × 10^5 ASD library cells and 2.3 × 10^5 control library cells positive for GFP were sorted by flow cytometry. Cells were recovered and passaged two times in 10 cm dishes to maintain maximum co...
units.rationale: Describes virus production and low‑MOI infection of stem cells.

units.title: Flow cytometry‑based gRNA reporter assay
units.text: Flow cytometry-based gRNA reporter assay. In this assay, a pre‑assembled array of gRNA‑targeting sequences fused with TagBFP is used to generate 3T3 fibroblast reporter cell lines. sgRNA and eCas9 are then delivered into the reporter cell lines by lentiviruses. Successful genome editing causes frameshift mutations, resulting in the loss of blue fluorescent protein (BFP) fluorescence, which enables the quantitative evaluation of gRNA efficiency (Fig. 1c and Extended Data Fig. 1b,c).
units.rationale: Provides a functional assay to measure guide RNA editing efficiency.

units.title: FACS‑based validation of perturbation phenotypes
units.text: Using a FACS‑based approach, we further confirmed the enrichment and depletion phenotypes in individually perturbed organoids for the four genes (KMT2C, LEO1, ADNP and WAC).
units.rationale: Details a flow‑sorting step used to validate screen hits.

units.title: Immunohistochemistry validation of protein loss
units.text: Immunohistochemistry analysis of several perturbations in organoids further confirmed the loss of protein expression in dorsal and ventral telencephalons (Extended Data Fig. 6k).
units.rationale: Describes a microscopy‑based method to verify gene knock‑down at the protein level.
